creator: dsooley

content:
As no one replied to your posting, I would not expect you to be getting emails from this site.

Most folk who actually see success with a reinstall have unwittingly identified the issue to be software outside of Thunderbird. Usually in the antivirus, firewall or VPN categories.

Having just read the titles of your plethora of questions (No that is all I read) I would guess you have a third party antivirus product installed that has caused most of the issue you have reported.

Do you have an exception for Thunderbird's profile folder from antivirus scanning in your antivirus? Not having that can be the cause of unsaved settings changes, sluggish behaviors and general failures to synchronize.

Have you ensured that the firewall component is set to allow Thunderbird regardless of version? Post update lots of folks have issue with getting their mail or even sending it. This is usually a result of alarmist security settings in the firewall that see the new version of software entrusted and blocked from the internet by the firewall for up to 2 weeks. Depending on the product and how long it takes it to phone home and learn there is a new version number is can trust.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: I was having issues with the computer earlier. I tried to clean the temp files and it hung so I just rebooted. That's when it stopped working. I am only running Windows Defender and Malwarebytes and have TBird exempted. I was freaking out. Whew!

creator: ask330

content:
Check Firewall: Firewall might be the computer default that came with OS or it might be controlled by an Anti-Virus you installed. Thunderbird must be set up as an allowed program otherwise firewall might block access.

Check VPN Have you enabled a VPN? Please double check - some Anti-Virus products come with a VPN which may have been auto enabled. Most servers do not like VPN as it hides IP, so server might think you are a hacker and block you. So switch off VPN or create a split tunnelling and set it up to allow Thunderbird to use it.

What settings are using? In Thunderbird

  • Help > Troubleshooting Information
  • Scroll down to 'Mail and News Accounts' section
  • Copy all the data nd paste it into this forum question OR upload an image showing the data.

I've not heard of the SMTP server name you are using , so do you have this hosted and this set up using a Microsoft office365 server?

I tried to check out fa-brains.com and apparently not a trusted website. not secure and looks maybe chinese or far eastern. Not much luck in that department.

creator: Mozilla-assistent

content:
Just above the Folder Pane there is a the 'Folder Pane Header'. It has a 'cloud' icon which means download/ get messages A '+New Message' button which means create a new Write/compose message. Note: In my added image the '+New Message' button has been altered to say the word 'Write', but it's the same thing in same location. 3 dot icon on the right access to drop down menu options.

However, if the 'Folder Pane Header' has been disabled then try the following to get it to show again:

  • Menu app icon (3 horizontal lines) > 'View' > 'Folders' > select 'Folder Pane Header'

If you want to hide the 'Folder Pane Header', but still have those buttons, you can add them to the 'Unified Toolbar'.

  • Right click on Unified Toolbar (it's the one at the top with the Global Search (Ctrl+K) and selct 'Customise'
  • You can then drag the 'Write' and the 'Get Messages' onto the 'Mail' Unified Toolbar view.
  • Then click on 'Save' to update which also auto closes the Customise form.

Added an image showing my Beta version 138.0b1
creator: Toad-Hall

Per di più molte variazioni al login sono applicate solo su una parte dell'utenza con il risultato paradossale che ad alcuni tutto funziona e ad altri no. E si finisce a dare la colpa al client...

content: If you look at your 'Quick Filter' toolbar, you will see you have the 'pin' icon enabled - it has a pink strip of colour. That means you have pinned a filter used elsewhere to apply to all folders. So the selected folder has a filter being applied. Click on the 'pin' icon to remove the filter.
creator: Toad-Hall
